Text: The MOVING reference member state of this VC (Value Chain) is ITALY VINIDEA. The reference MOVING Card ID of this VC is VC 23 IT. the value chain pertains organic production of champenois wines by the Ferrari company. The company, historically based in Trento processes the grapes of their own farms, of about 300 small farmers of the area. About 5 years ago they funded a study on the impact of climate change on wine quality and on the basis of the outcome they decided to invest in an area that till now was not considered suitable for vineyards. The vineyard was planted and is now in production, still to be assessed the consequences of quality and the response to climate change (it needs longer periods).   The reference mountain chain of this VC is Eastern Alps. The reference mountain landscape of this VC is Trento. Trento is the capital of Trentino Autonomous province. Its territory includes the city but also the surroundings, whose large part is mountains. Agriculture use to play an important role in the province but it is progressively abandoning higher areas (where traditionally animal husbandry was more common) and concentrate on plant production (grape, apples, berries, vegetables.). Tourism is very important and counts on the high environmental and landscape quality. The type of landscape is typically alpine but with the advantage of good infrastructures and a city in proximity.   The size of the area (km2) is 158. Overall the type of challenge faced by this VC is Current. This VC is classified as Traditional and Innovative.   The type of innovation of this VC (Value Chain) is Endogenous. the innovative aspects relate to the fact that vineyards have been planted at an altitude higher that usual, based on a previous study on climate change forecast, and to the fact that the whole management is organic. The innovation is related to New processes and New marketing strategies. The land use systems involved are Cropland and vineyards. The local assets include Natural.   Wine sector is concerned about climate change, both in terms of vineyards sustainability (increasing water needs, new pests and diseases.) and wine quality (maturation problems, different win characteristics etc.). As a consequence several trials are going on in wine regions to assess the potentials of going upwards with the vineyard cultivation and that could be a lever to regain to agriculture what are today considered marginal areas.
